I just saw I doewnloaded 2 times the rpm files.. there r some deb too, should I try that?

run this command and it will be fine:    cd ~; wget http://solutions.brother.com/Library/sol/printer/linux/rpmfiles/lpr_debian/dcp135clpr-1.0.1-1.i386.deb; sudo dpkg -i ./dcp135clpr-1.0.1-1.i386.deb; sudo apt-get -f install; rm ./dcp135clpr-1.0.1-1.i386.deb
that command will install it for you
just run the command I gave and it will install. If you then attatch your printer it may install, if not then run through the printer install wizard and the driver will be in the list
Dr_Willis: don't you need to run the browser with gksudo tough?

http://solutions.brother.com/linux/sol/printer/linux/lpr_drivers.html    grab the link on the RIGHT hand side for your model, that is a deb file. You can then download it and double click it to install
just download the file and double click it, sounds just like you would do in windows
there are 2 columns, the left is for RPM files (for redhat /  mandriva etc) and the right column is for DEB files (for ubuntu and debian etc)
that deb file will give you the driver you need.
